page.title: 14PORT OF MENTEITH FISHING
page.content: The Lake of Menteith is very well known for its fishing. From old records we have learned that the monks at the priory of Inchmahome introduced pike into the lake about 500 years ago. This was an important source of food and they used swans to catch the pike. Today pike are considered to be a nuisance because they feed on smaller fish such as trout. Fishing as a sport is one of the things which brings in money to the district. The fishing in the lake is controlled by the Angling Association who own 25 boats. A charge of Â£12 per boat is made and each boat is allowed to have 3 rods. Each rod is restricted to catching 10 fish. The Angling Association was formed in 1967 and is comprised of the owners of the land surrounding the lake.
